comment.author: 20612279@N00
comment._content:
How odd.  I have this as a postcard from 1991 (it was one of a series which were given away by Mars Confectionery in the run-up to the Barcelona/Albertville Olympics in 1992) but the text appears to be in a slightly different font.  The spacing is different.  Both appear to have hand-drawn text.

Phil.

comment.author: 25161698@N02
comment._content:
I was seven months old then.
Could this account for my lifelong hatred of all sports !

comment.author: 34874196@N05
comment._content: The license for this poster says  "No known restrictions". Yet the deccription says "Its design is a copyright of the International Olympic Committee.". Can you tell me which is correct please? So are there any restrictions on this poster image at all?

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: The rings are the protected intellectual property of the IOC / BOA which makes re-use difficult, however they were happy to allow the poster's use here in a 'collections' context. You can see more Olympics posters from the collections of the V&A at: collections.vam.ac.uk/exhibition/a-century-of-olympic-pos...

comment.author: 83871714@N02
comment._content: this logo is so much better than the London 2012 silly logo.
